website_summaries.verdict: The Rolls Royce of step ladders. If you want the best on the market, this is the one to get.
pros: Extremely stable and lightweight due to aircraft-grade aluminum construction
Can double as an extension ladder or as a scaffolding system
cons: On the more expensive end, but it will likely be the only ladder you will ever need to buy

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware
customer_reviews.text: The model 13 is not 13 feet. It only extends to 11 feet. This is a misprint by Amazon. The back of the pamphlet that comes with the ladder lists the little giant model #s available with some quick states. Also, Model 17 extends to 15 feet. Model 22 extends to 19 feet.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: It's not safe, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this brand when it first came out. They used to make quality ladders. Unfortunately, their quality control has much to be desired. This ladder came apart the first day I used it. One of the locking pins came loose. The plastic covers fell off. Nowadays, this ladder resembles more a toy than a construction ladder. It's not a safe ladder, do not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Zelaya

customer_reviews.title: Climb with safety.
customer_reviews.text: I love a well engineered product and this one is really a clever and useful advance in ladders for homeowners. Works fine and is very sturdy. We have 12-foot ceilings and we use this ladder to get up to the ceiling fans for adjustment, etc. The ladder is worth the cost and feels safe and stable when I use it. I'm no stranger to ladders, having used our 28-foot extension ladder on the outside of a prior home to paint the shiplap siding all the way up to the peak. The Little Giant is my go-to ladder now for most work around the inside/outside of our current 1-story home.
customer_reviews.author: Older and Wiser

customer_reviews.title: Overall will be useful to tackle tons of jobs over the years - read my positives and negatives
customer_reviews.text: I had two ladders at home, both fiberglass which were super light. Needed this to attempt painting up 20ish feet inside of our staircase up to the ceiling. Positives: its a pretty great system of being able to change the angle of opening and closing and everything is VERY well built, safe, sturdy Negatives: the reviews talk about how easy it is to move around and whatnot however I'll say its heavy and hard to maneuver especially in tight spaces. Overall there is tons of functionality with a wide range of jobs that this ladder can do but don't expect to easily be able to move it around like the fiberglass ones.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile ladder
customer_reviews.text: Everything you hear about the Little Giant is true. It's an incredibly versatile tool. It took a couple tries to get used to make sure I'm in the right position to use the various configurations without dropping the ladder or having to move it after extending. This is a very heavy unit, but the wheels help when maneuvering around. I found if I crouch slightly and balance it on one shoulder, carrying it upright, it's also well-balanced and easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: dberman

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly has heavy as I feared. Very sturdy. Wheels on two legs are a big plus. I looked at a Werner ladder brand in Lowe's, and this one is, by far, worth the extra cost, as least as far as I'm concerned. No rough metal. Lighter weight. Easier and safer to operate. Wheels. More comfortable steps. Easy to open and extend, once I got the hang of it. Just takes care and thought. I'm pushing 71, female, and I can still manage this. In fact, I use it as a bridge over a chainlink fence. Just takes leverage. It is engineered not to pinch fingers when opening and closing. The Werner is not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: This ladder is sturdy and flexible and the 22 inch reach is good ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought that this ladder would be too heavy but it is ideal since the weight is manageable for me and the additional height provides more flexibility. Be sure to use safe practices especially on your roof. Have the top of the ladder extending above the roof and anchor the bottom of the ladder on a flat surface or with supports. Ensure that the angle of the ladder is right so it is stable and don't overextend your reach. This ladder is sturdy and flexible and the 22 inch reach is good for high places.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph F

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and utility
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ladder, it’s very long and useful for all applications as the angle can be adjusted. I’ve used on stairs, to get onto the roof and to paint siding all at great ease. It’s very sturdy and folds away for great storage, doesn’t take up too much space. It’s quite heavy to move but given the size of the ladder it could be much worse. Great quality product
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are sorely lacking
customer_reviews.text: A couple of the plastic trim pieces came off and I can't get them back on. However, they don't seem to affect the functioning. The print instructions could be a lot better, I don't have time to consult YouTube or a video to learn how to work a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: For your average homeowner that needs to use a ladder every once in a while to clean gutters, change lightbulbs, and other odds and ends, this ladder can't be beat. Very happy with it. This size is perfect for my single story ranch home.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: First and last ladder...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first ladder I’ve ever bought and likely the last too...because it’s incredible! This ladder is so versitile and does it all. It’s easy to carry around the house without having to worry about bumping it into walls or door frames. Adjustments are easy, straightforward, and there is a great sense of security while on this ladder. There is no need for another ladder unless it’s another one of these!
customer_reviews.author: John Buczynski

customer_reviews.title: Best ladder I've had ever
customer_reviews.text: The video makes it look as though you can carry it with 2 Fingers. You cant. It is quite heavy but it is my one and only ladder, I'm no handyman so this is great for me around the house. Very sturdy and easy to use, hint: watch the DVD first it helps if like me your not Henry the handy husband.
customer_reviews.author: talonmedic

customer_reviews.title: it's a pretty wobbly and the steps/rungs are very
customer_reviews.text: Due to a hurricane, we used this little number quite a bit after our purchase. It held up okay and didn't have any of the structural failures or finger pinching I read about. However, it's a pretty wobbly and the steps/rungs are very, very narrow. You definitely need someone to hold the bottom steady if you are using it extended. On the plus side, the wheels made it easy to maneuver and it folds up and stores nicely. I will eventually replace it with a stronger one, but it was what we could get in the time we needed it. I gave it three stars because it is just ~ meh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as I had hoped.
customer_reviews.text: For such a highly rated ladder I expected it to be easier to use, more manageable, and feel sturdy. Sometimes the ladder would wobble with both legs on the ground NOT EXTENDED. I might have returned it if it wasn't on sale, but I needed one at the moment and was the best I could find. I would look to try your ladder first before making your choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Slightly narrow rungs compared to the older Type 1 Ladders
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that this units width between the vertical rungs have shrunk slightly. I purchased an aluminum scaffolding to stretch between my older Little Giant and this unit. The scaffolding slides between the side rungs on my older ladder, but won't fit between the ones on the newer one. Guess I'll have to get creative on how to secure the scaffolding on this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: This is excellent! I've been using it to help with painting ...
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent! I've been using it to help with painting and installing ceiling fans. It's great because it can be broken into 2 ladders! It was great to use while I had multiple people helping you out with painting my house. I also love them because the ladder is super stable. If you use just one part it isn't bad. But if you use both, the ladder is not going anywhere! I haven't used it to its full height yet, but I'll update my review when I have! I got it after the recommendation from my uncle! He said it was one of his favorite ladders and I really see why!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle H.

customer_reviews.title: Also the locking system is not good. I fell on the floor and had to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy and awkward to handdle. Also the locking system is not good. I fell on the floor and had to take time off from my work for days. I had buy an another ladder which is safer than this for my project. I will still keep this ladder because it's difficult to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Young Hyun De Saw

customer_reviews.title: Read Carefully before you buy...
customer_reviews.text: Guys, This product is for industrial use rather than households use. Note it is really heavy and requires extra attention to fold, unfold and extend. If you think of buying it to an elderly person or wife, you better have a second thought. I purchased it to use it around the house but could not. moving it around the house and on stairs is something exhausting. I took it to my workshop where I could use it there. I rated it five because it is sturdy, practical and well finished product.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST LADDER EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Have had the 22' ladder for years and LOVE how stable it is, so when we 'downsized' to a new home and I didn't need a ladder that tall, I got this 17' ladder, which is a bit lighter and has the wheels for easier transportation. Same high and heavy-duty quality construction. Gave my old 22'-er to my son, along with the outrigger arms, uneven surface leveler, but kept the step platform for myself.
customer_reviews.author: bobd441

customer_reviews.title: Don't cheap out just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy it because I had heard it was super heavy. Low and behold it's not that bad and it has wheels so moving it around was a breeze. The multiple configurations allows me to use it in many different heights and configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Dr

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable Ladder What Can Go Wrong
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely nothing, that's what. This ladder is great I have used it in many positions all of which feel sturdy and usable. The adjusting sides really work well for stair situations and helps you get to those hard to reach spots. Don't buy any other ladder just get this Little Bugger... *clears throat* little Giant
customer_reviews.author: YT_ENREVIEWS

customer_reviews.title: Great Tall Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I love this ladder. I already had two ladders, but none of them allowed me to climb on the roof safely. This one does. It goes high enough that I don't have to be an acrobat to get on the roof. The only drawback is that this ladder is heavy for a woman my size to move, even though it has wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Readers

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ladder, perfect for getting to challenging places! Our roof has some interesting roof lines and it was perfect for getting there safely and hanging lights.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Mcmuff

customer_reviews.title: Great work!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. If you are a fledgling home owner like myself, with barely a need for a ladder, this thing is perfect. Gets me up above the garage door to change the light bulb that blew 3 days after buying my new house! It's light and easy to manuever. It was highly recommended to me, and I highly recommend it to you. Might want to upgrade to the higher quality one of your a bigger guy. But I'm a relatively big guy and I was up about 25 feet on it and felt no wavering or anything. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory F.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Easy to move around for a single person.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is very sturdy. There are multiple models which was confusing for me at the time of buying this. It appears the difference is mostly in how conveniently can you change the angle of the 'A' and how conveniently can you extend the length/height of the ladder. This one requires firmly pushing or pulling the stoppers. In other models, this operation is a bit more convenient, but may not be worth the extra $$$ depending on what you are looking for. I am pretty happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: fantom user

customer_reviews.title: Best ladder for just about anything!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this ladder in small spaces, on stairs, around corners, and all kinds of things. It's a bit heavier than your normal ladder because of all the extra features that make this function with such versatility. I was a bit intimidated when I saw there was an entire instructional DVD, but the quick sheet has been more than adequate for all the basics. No idea how I've gotten along without this for so long, especially with painting! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: S. Steinbeck

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for and this is a high quality piece of engineering! Easy learning curve to mastering the many uses of this ladder. I really do love this and it is especially valuable for those with RV's as these will fit in many of the storage compartments. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Berry

customer_reviews.title: It's made to last
customer_reviews.text: Still getting used to it, so in a few weeks I may give it 5 stars! My old aluminum step ladder was finally retired when a bolt broke off (not while I was on it!) and I decided to replace it with a Little Giant. It took less than 5 minutes to learn how to adjust it. It's a little heavier than my old ladder, but the wheels really help in moving it around over concrete and other hard floor surfaces. I haven't tried it over grass yet but I expect just carrying it might be the way to go there. It feels very sturdy and well made, and the latches and releases work well.
customer_reviews.author: blueskys

customer_reviews.title: easy to manage and goes anywhere
customer_reviews.text: Husband feels safe using this little giant. More so than top brands. Was able to get on top of a 20” building without an issue by himself. I was with him, but he got the job done. Lightweight, easy to manage and goes anywhere! Perfect for every project tall or small.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ladder. lighter than the 300-lbs rated (this one ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent ladder. lighter than the 300-lbs rated (this one is 250-lbs rated). Took one star out because, if extended, it truly tires your feet as the step becomes narrower like other users mentioned. It would still be great for short durations to reach something.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Love this ladder
customer_reviews.text: I love this ladder. I have been using it since the day it arrived. I have used it indoors and outside also. It is easy to use once you figure it out. It is a little heavy for me but I am older and have back problems. Should not be a problem for anyone without back problems. It does have the rollers on the bottom, so I just use those. I manage to get it where I want with hardly any problem. I would recommend this to anyone that needs a good sturdy ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: ... but when you put it in place you feel like it is going to stay there
customer_reviews.text: This Little Giant might be bit heavy but when you put it in place you feel like it is going to stay there. The multipurpose nature of the ladder makes it very easy to work at different locations from the middle of the room putting up a fan or to the top of my house to check a chimney(the house has steep roofs).
customer_reviews.author: Firedragon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Heavy...
customer_reviews.text: It is very adjustable but it is also heavier than basic extension or step ladders. When fully extended as a step ladder the rungs are very narrow (not as wide as a traditional step ladder). The wheels help to move it around, and it's ability to adjust to stairs and along a wall is a very nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: David Giorda

customer_reviews.title: Better Ladder than the Others
customer_reviews.text: Very smart design, great workmanship, stable, safe, doesn't try to bite you. Superior to other name brand folding / telescopic ladders that I own.
customer_reviews.author: C4DB

customer_reviews.title: This ladder is really awesome and worth spending the extra on
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is really awesome and worth spending the extra on. I can carry this around and extend it all by myself. It is very sturdy (got the 17 foot one) and I was able to climb up and fix my rain gutter on the backside of my one-story house without any problems at all. I highly recommend this over cheaper ladder systems.
customer_reviews.author: Fuj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution
customer_reviews.text: I watched this ladder for months. It finally went on sale for a price that seemed smart. Now that I have it I would have paid the list price. It's simple to set up, easy to move and replaced 2 other heavy fiberglass ladders. I can easily carry it around the yard or get it upstairs. Turning it into scaffolds was simple and worked great for a recent painting project. The ladder it well made, light compared to my old 8 foot fiberglass ladder and works for everything from painting the ceiling, to trimming the trees to cleaning our gutters. Save your back, get this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: J. Healy

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, but not an extension ladder
customer_reviews.text: As expected, this is a very versatile ladder. At a shade over 220 I am pushing this ladder's weight limit and it definitely feels that way when it is in extension mode. There is a significant amount of flex at the knuckle that might make your stomach turn 15' off the ground. I would not recommend this if your primary use of it is going to be as an extension ladder. Spend the extra money and buy the less versatile extension ladder as that is it's sole purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Versital
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ladder! Purchased for my parents (early 70's) who still function like they are in their 30's. Unfortunately the ladder they were using was from my before youth. Safe, compact, light, versatile. Just what was needed for them...and I bought one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Paul's Corner

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: This started off with poor shipping and handling. Item was beat up and some molded plastic pieces were cracked. It’s has been used no more than 10 times in the last 18 months. Today I used it to seal an end-cap on a gutter and when I went to set the ladder up the pieces that hold the ladder in place came off right in my hand. You can see from the picture that this is the ultimate piece of s#!+. A ladder should last a lifetime if you spent $200 on it. Not less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: Jae Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Too short to reach gutters
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly my own fault for not measuring better—thought this would be middle aged woman’s answer to heavy ladder moving. So , it is that, but too short. Bought reduced, and guess it was returned by last person bc too short. Too much trouble to return, alas. So keeping for shorter uses.
customer_reviews.author: KathrynMargaret

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder, small profile ... check your local costco for better deal
customer_reviews.text: The ladder itself was very good. I have no complaints on how the ladder performs. Its very sturdy and and considering the height that you get, its not heavy. However it maybe abit on the heavy side for petite woman to carry around. If you're considering about picking this up, check your local Costco first. You may be able to find it cheaper with some free attachments. The only reason I didn't get it from Costco was because it wouldn't fit in my car, even with my SUV.
customer_reviews.author: Denzil Khine

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality, but heavy
customer_reviews.text: Little Giant makes the best quality ladders that money can buy. It's sturdy and supports many flexible uses. Great to have around the house. Like most of their ladders, it is quite heavy. These ladders now have wheels on them to make it easier to get around, but you'll find that most of your use is over areas that don't support the wheels, like lawn or carpet. If the weight doesn't bother you, try this ladder. It'll last forever.
customer_reviews.author: B. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Replace 3 ladders with this one! Saves space and lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful ladder purchase. It's pretty compact and is kind of a multi use ladder...we were able to replace 3 ladders in the garage with this ONE that you can even order a hanger for to put on the wall. It was great for painting high ceiling in the stairwell as well as hanging Christmas lights up high. The ladder is surprisingly light. I wish I would have purchased this for my husband a long time ago...it's saved us space and the multiple uses are amazing! HIGHLY recommend this to anyone needing a ladder!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Earlier, I wrote this review “I’ve used this ladder about 4 or 5 times and it’s jammed in the folded position and now can’t be used. All attempts to release the jammed knob have failed. Big waste of money!” It turned out, after contacting their customer service, they’re trying to replace parts or all of the ladder. So, I’m happy now that I didn’t waste my money. Love good service and companies that stand by their products!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Giangrosso

customer_reviews.title: Love it, in spite of minor flaws in this slightly used Little Giant.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ladder, but I have a couple of issues. Because it was offered a slightly used, I did not expect perfection; however the tape used to hold it together for shipping tended to pull off the instruction labels on the legs. I addition, one of the wheels at the bottom is broken. It works, but will eventually break off I think. Aside from these minor issues, this Little Giant is avery good quality ladder, and I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome D. Essex

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Have several things around the house from getting in to the attic to getting into the huge tree in our front yard and this ladder checks every box I needed. Delivery was fast (box was damaged but ladder was fine). Ladder is extremely easy to use and stores very securely and out of the way in the garage taking up no more space than a regular ladder. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed you may not be
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I got this as a return. But I got no reply to just replace the leg ends,I didn’t mind repairing the bent legs, all I wanted was the little wheel ends. But sadly no.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Multi-function Ladder!
customer_reviews.text: I could not have asked for a better ladder to offer multiple solutions for my home - it does exactly what I need for a town home with mixed ceiling heights, narrow stairways, and vaulted ceilings on the top floors. This concept is one of the best inventions of our time.
customer_reviews.author: IMApisces

customer_reviews.title: This ladder is built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest ladder I've ever own! I will never own a normal a frame ladder again. This ladder is built like a tank! It's super well constructed and even extended to it maximum height I feel safe on it. The one caution I would say is the ladder is heavy but if you want a super sturdy ladder that wont blow over in the wind while your on it this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, love everything about it
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, love everything about it, super solid, pretty much what I expected in weight. My only sadness is that I've run into 1 scenario where I kind of wish I'd gone a size up. Thats on me though, maybe keep it in mind for yourself though.
customer_reviews.author: Lee E.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, flexible, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most sturdy, flexible and yet lightweight ladder I have owned. Easy to extend into any position. Small for carrying or rolling around the house. Prices vary. In this instance Amazon had the best deal, especially with Prime shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder - very heavy and somewhat awkward, if you're of slight build
customer_reviews.text: This thing is HEAVY, but it's solid and easy to adjust. Can't ask for more! Box did come damaged and the ladder was scuffed, but I didn't see any point in returning it or asking for a discount, since it worked perfectly. It'll see more scuffs over the years, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, reasonably easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to change air filters and light bulbs in a house with 10 foot and 12 foot ceilings. This is just fine in the 10 foot floors. I'm 5'5" so its a bit dangerous on the 12 foot floor. However its light enough for me to lift on my own and its very solid and safe. Good investment overall.
customer_reviews.author: Amy McGee

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: Been working this ladder hard every day for almost two years now and it still works great. Heavier than 10 fiberglass ladders combines but it needs to be. I trust my life with these ladders everyday and it has yet to fail me.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome seller
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder. Not as heavy as expected. Pretty easy to maneuver to the different set ups.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money! Easy to set up, and configure to what your doing. It’s not too heavy to maneuver around. Stores perfectly hanging in my garage.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: good sturdy design
customer_reviews.text: A bit too much for an occasional home use, but delivers whats expected from it. Not too heavy but still heavier than other low tech cousins of this ladder. I think to get full advantage from it, one needs the accessories that need to be ordered separately. Overall, good sturdy design, good functionality, arrived in time. No complaints yet. Four stars because one needs to order the accessories separately and they are not cheap, and also it is not as light weight as they make it appear in commercial.
customer_reviews.author: AUA

customer_reviews.title: It's only 19' long, not 22'
customer_reviews.text: I thought I ordered a 22' ladder. It works great for my house but I went to use it at a friend's two-story house and extended it all the way for the first time only to find that it's 19' at full extension.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Came damaged
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I used the ladder one of the four bottom rubber feet broke. It looks like the little piece that clips it on to the ladder is either missing or broke during shipment. Now I have to move the ladder to where I want to use it and then slide the 4th leg cap in manually in order to use it. I wish that didn’t happen as the ladder is fantastic in every other way.
customer_reviews.author: Reno Provine

customer_reviews.title: This ladder made it easy to adjust from a 4 ft to a 12ft ...
customer_reviews.text: This ladder made it easy to adjust from a 4 ft to a 12ft A Frame. Used this to take down Hurricane Shutters on the second floor windows with ease as it transformed from A frame to a extension latter.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Coonrod

customer_reviews.title: this ladder is very good for all lot of things that you have to ...
customer_reviews.text: this ladder is very good for all lot of things that you have to do around the house. it is a little difficult to get it opened though
customer_reviews.author: Mary H.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the thing so far. Haven't used it on stairs or fully straight but seems to work well at the different levels in the bent positions. My only complaint would be its super heavy. I have a bad back and cannot carry it myself. But it's a metal ladder so it's expected it would be heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Mom-of-one-boy

customer_reviews.title: Safe heavy duty ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is a ladder I use often and take with me everywhere strapped to the back of my motor home. This not your flimsy aluminum ladder that wobbles and shakes, this is a OSHA approved ladder that is extremely versatile. Pros: Light weight for this type of product Doesn't wobble as long as you put it on level ground All kinds of uses Has a neat way to use it on stairs and stay level Cons: Only one, it's heavier than that flimsy wobbly ladder that most people have but then it's not flimsy or wobbly
customer_reviews.author: FormosaTiger

customer_reviews.title: a little giant
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our house and to do handywork around the house (hanging mirrors, curtains). I like this ladder because it is small in space but it can reach long lengths. I would buy this again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is a very good ladder for around the house chores
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a very good ladder for around the house chores. It doesn't feel real sturdy but I believe it's do to the lighter weight compared to heavy duty ones. When it co.es down to it I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Man o' work

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ladder for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This ladder literally paid for itself the day after I bought it. I don't like heights and I'll climb to the top of this ladder on a windy day no problem with a drill and some other object in hand. I trust this ladder is what I'm saying.
customer_reviews.author: That I.T. Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great product but purchase at least one size larger than you think you need.
customer_reviews.text: This product works as advertised,easy to adjust, and store in a corner. The ladder is both light and heavy duty. As mentioned in other reviews however, do be careful when collapsing the ladder as the legs slide rapidly and you wouldn't want your fingers to be in the wrong place. My personal view is that it would be better to purchase a longer model as for not much more bulk or weight the ladder would be much more versatile and handle a larger array of jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Compact, stable, strong ladder. Multiple uses for everyone.
customer_reviews.text: Use this almost daily. Very stable and doesnt take up much room on my truck. I use it when trimming tall shrubs as well as when power washing high structures. Keeps me off the building so I can wash more area before needing to move. Wheels are a big plus after a long day.
customer_reviews.author: A.Team

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: This damn ladder has so many features it's almost ridiculous. You can use it as an A frame, or straighten it out and use it for higher work. You can extend one side or the other, to compensate for uneven ground, or make it into a taller straight ladder by extending both sides and leaving it fully extended. For the price and weight, it's a highly capable ladder. I don't believe hype or infomercials, so I was reluctant to give this a try. I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal on a Great Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I have been watching the price of the Little Giant since it came on the market. This year, a competitor had a coupon sale that was very popular, but I found the "real" thing on Amazon. It was more expensive than the competitor, but finally fit in my price range. It's light and flexible - even the box it was delivered in was easy to carry! There is a longer version, but this one fits the bill and was priced very reasonably.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Must have for churches!!
customer_reviews.text: We borrowed one of these to use for our stage at church which, has a 25ft celing. Immediately, I ordered one for our campus! Super steady and VERY useful! Love it! Never thought I'd enjoy using a ladder! Just makes life better! It extends far enough for our light bar that is about 20ft up.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Compact folding ladder stores away easily, expands for many uses
customer_reviews.text: I've looked at these for a few years and finally decided to own one. All in all easy to manage putting it in various configurations. You need a little space to lay it out for some setups. It feels quite stable in use and I'm glad I purchased it. You do need to pay attention to your fingers as you change the setup.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Definitly BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is awesome. There is no reason to look for any other style. It is a bit on the heavy side as compared to the lightweight aluminum ladders, but you pay for the quality. This ladder manipulates easily, changes angles well and holds strong. I would definitely recommend buying this ladder for projects around the house!
customer_reviews.author: S. Ayers

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Its cool but learn how it works before you pull the latches out and smash the heck out of your right pinky toe haha. Or where safety toe shoes when dealing with it. This bad boy packs a punch I exploded the meat on the side of my foot haha. The ladder works great though. Sturdy as heck. Way better than any ladder I have ever used that wasn't on a fire truck.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Moore

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to store and move.
customer_reviews.text: When I moved I needed a good ladder that had flexibility to be used for many different task. This ladder has delivered, and because it can be folded into such a small package, I can store it in an empty closet.
customer_reviews.author: Catie Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this ladder! Easy to put in just about any position you could ever need, (at least for me). And, it folds up to a perfect size for storage in our small shed. Very well made and easy enough for one person to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a ladder to replace a lightbulb on a high ceiling section of my home and this ladder was just the right height, although, I would watch your hand placement as some other reviews have said because I can see how you may get clip while converting it
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Really useful and versatile for serious jobs around the house
customer_reviews.text: Really useful and versatile for serious jobs around the house, just know it's a little heavy. A pain when you need something quick because the boy threw something on top of the whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Matrix Driver

customer_reviews.title: Stores like a step ladder, functions like an extension ladder!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase in a while. Who doesnt need a ladder for those one time circumstances. So far I used this to clear Ice damn's of my roof, rehang a swing, and will be using it to trip some branches on a tree. This thing stores quite nicely and no bigger than a regular step ladder.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: I love that you're able to get closer to the wall ...
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile ladder, and doesn't wobble while you're on it. I love that you're able to get closer to the wall as you adjust the height of the ladder, and the accessories you can buy to go with it are very useful. Highly recommend this product, I am considering buying the larger model as well.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Priestley

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes there's no substitute for a versatile tool like this one - don't know how I've gotten along ...
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes there's no substitute for a versatile tool like this one - don't know how I've gotten along without this ladder! Actually, I do know how: I've had to use three other ladders to equal this one in function. You'll be happy you've got this tool in your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: George C

customer_reviews.title: Great, but Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Cosmic product, but relatively heavy. Love the quality/utility of this thing and, given the extension to 22', wouldn't buy/use the lighter weight knock-offs of similar design, but it requires wrestling to set up/put in place. A fit 70-year old can do it, but if you have trouble hauling your luggage on travel, just hire someone for the high work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Pace

customer_reviews.title: Great little ladder
customer_reviews.text: I was about to purchase an extension ladder but really didn't want to have a huge ladder in my garage taking up space. Then I came across the little giant and boy am I glad I did. Takes up almost no space in my garage and get to most of the spot on my house. My only complaint towards myself is that I should have gotten the 24 or 26. On my colonial I'm just short of getting to the gutters safely. More of my fault than little giant.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder and manageable for a female
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder and manageable for a female. I’m 5”8, 140 lbs and between 45-50 yrs old. The smaller size is easier for me to manage and much easier to open and close. Great utility ladder for the house.
customer_reviews.author: shannon walker

customer_reviews.title: Quality, at a price.
customer_reviews.text: The Alta version of the Little Giant line is well suited for my uses. It's relatively light, the adjustments are easy and they lock in securely.I'm 57 yo and I can maneuver it easily on my own. It feels like it's built to last. I'm knocking down the rating one star because the cost compared to other ladders is a little steep, for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Willy Dyno

customer_reviews.title: but I've gotten accustomed to it and nothing bad has happened
customer_reviews.text: Solid ladder. Being the fold out that it is, there is some give in the joints that was a little nerve wracking the first time, but I've gotten accustomed to it and nothing bad has happened. The rungs feel a bit small for my feet at size 10 American Mens. Overall though it is a really great ladder that has a small garage profile which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfburns

customer_reviews.title: I am happy that I purchased this Little Giant ladder
customer_reviews.text: I am happy that I purchased this Little Giant ladder. I feel safe when I use it. I do need help moving it. This is a very sturdy ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Georgette Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this ladder daily for several weeks now, and have grown quite comfortable with it. As a home inspector, I use this ladder to access roofs and attics. I don't spend a lot of time standing on the ladder. If I did, I would imagine that the thin rungs would be painful after a while. The ladder operates smoothly and is much lighter than the comparable Werner model of the same size. It's about the same weight as the Featherlite Jaws ladder, but significantly less expensive. The wheels are pretty pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Havelka

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: It was actually taller than expected and heavier. I also expected wheels with this version, but don't be this the smalest of all in it version is very versatile and fits the smallest storage spaces and actually can reach most everyday places inside and outside.The platform accessory is the best. I will actually recommend the additional accessories, like the wheels and fuel cell.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hackett

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT GIFT!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think my father has loved any gift I have given him over the years as much as he has loved this ladder. He is very arthritic and hates fighting with anything that's a little on the heavy side as it gives him a lot of pain, yet, he's very active around the house, so this ladder has become his best friend. I have even borrowed it for home projects and am really starting to see why he likes it. I have never felt so secure on a ladder before the the little giant.
customer_reviews.author: klstoner

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty ladder.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Ladder. Needed one to be versatile for both using to get into my attic as well as gutters. this answered that perfectly. A really sturdy and heavy ladder so be warned it isn't a very light weight ladder, but very well made, and as stated heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Envy of the neighborhood
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself, but the neighborhood men volunteered to check my roof, etc. They said it was the best ladder on the market and have agreed to to my work for me....A widow with a big "Little Giant."
customer_reviews.author: C. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: pretty heavy though to haul around
customer_reviews.text: works as advertised. pretty heavy though to haul around, so I still end up using smaller ladders (which I was hoping to toss) any time I can avoid this thing, so primarily end up using it only when need it fully extended. Weight was advertised, so not really subtracting stars for this.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Well built ladder!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use it for much height so far but coming from a non ladder climbing person, I'd say that I feel safe when climbing on this one. It feels sturdy, good quality, locks well. I'm hoping this as my first real ladder lasts longer than I will.
customer_reviews.author: grandmasterv

customer_reviews.title: Weighs more than I imagined.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I thought. Because of this it is not as useful as I had hoped. Also be careful as you can pinch your fingers if not careful. Very well built.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the multi-positioning and it's not heavy for me, a 5' girl to carry around the house.
customer_reviews.author: L. Purawinata

customer_reviews.title: Little Big Giant
customer_reviews.text: Perfect when you need a ladder that’s transportable but functional no matter the height needed for your project. Love it! Bought one for my son in law as well.
customer_reviews.author: Firegirl

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but versatile
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder and perfect for my needs. It's a bit heavy but it's a good compromise for having a 4' folded up 17' ladder at my disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing ladder, does all it is intended to do
customer_reviews.text: Amazing ladder, does all it is intended to do. Is on the heavy side for similar sized ladders but has many more features than a simple ladder. Seems durable, I expect it to last a long time. Great design!
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder system!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for around the house and outside the house. Not very heavy (though I'm a 28 year old Male and in decent shape). I was able to hang christmas lights out side with ease and had no worries about the stability of the ladder while on it
customer_reviews.author: Tommy post

product_meta.title: Little Giant 14013-001 Model 17 250 Lbs Capacity Alta-One Ladder, 15 Feet
product_meta.description:
Size Name:Model 1714013-001. Features: Enjoy unmatched feeling of stability in any situation thanks to aircraft-grade aluminum, the wide-flared legs and the highest quality construction. Use the model in a-frame, extension, 90-degree ladder and 3 different scaffolding positions, buy one ladder to do the job of five. Use the right ladder for the right job every time and avoid 95% of all ladder-related safety issues. Product type: Multi-position ladder. Color: Silver, orange. Duty rating: Type ia (extra heavy duty) 300 lbs. Folding: Yes. Lightweight: Yes. Rust resistant: Yes. Slip-resistant feet: Yes. Slip-resistant steps: Yes. Telescoping: Yes. Number of steps: 8. Dimensions: Storage height: 55". Overall height - top to bottom: 15 feet. Overall product weight: 29 pounds.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Little Giant Alta-One Model 17 is the lightest 17-foot multi-use ladder on the market. The Alta-One is the ultimate in strength, safety and versatility. You can count on quality performance for years to come. The hinge locks and telescoping sides let you safely use the Little Giant Alta-One as an adjustable extension ladder, A-frame ladder, staircase ladder, and as trestle-and-plank scaffolding system. Wide-flared legs, rubberized feet, and high-quality construction give you unmatched stability in any of its 24 unique configurations. Because it is constructed of aerospace-grade aluminum, the Alta-One is ultra-light and ultra-strong. The Alta-One is rated to hold up to 250 lbs. on both sides, so it’s perfect for medium-sized jobs.
feature_bullets: Heavy-wall aircraft-grade aluminum construction ; Storage Depth: 8.5 inch , Storage height: 4'7" ; Width at base: 23.5 Inch
Offers multiple configurations, as an A-frame,staircase,extension, 90-degree ladder or as a scaffolding system.
Complies with all applicable OSHA & ANSI A14.2 standards. The Little Giant is made of heavy-wall, 6005-T5 aluminum—the very same material used in aerospace construction
Rated to hold up to 250 lbs and is lightweight and portable
